followUpEmail.subject: Offer Letter - {{programName}} 2025!
followUpEmail.html:
Dear {{firstName}},


On behalf of The Oxford Institute, I am delighted to offer you provisional admission to the {{programName}} 2025, held at St Anne’s College, University of Oxford. Congratulations on securing this exciting opportunity!

Conditional Offer and Payment Details

This offer is conditional upon the payment of a minimum deposit of £1,999 or the full program fee (£{{programPrice}}) within 10 working days of receiving this letter. You may complete the transaction using this link: https://buy.stripe.com/aEUcMZ0M62Wo0SI7ss (a 3.5% surcharge will be applied to all online payments to cover card processing fees) or you may use the bank details below to make the payment directly:

  1. Bank Name: Barclays Bank
  2. Account Name: The Oxford Institute
  3. Sort Code: 20-08-64
  4. Account Number: 00399833
  5. Swift Code: BUKBGB22
  6. IBAN: GB86BUKB 20086400399833
  7. Branch: 54 Cornmarket St, Oxford, OX1 3HB, United Kingdom


Your Oxford Experience


We are thrilled to welcome you to Oxford, where we’re committed to providing an enriching and unforgettable experience that enhances your education and fully immerses you in “The Oxford Experience.” Designed to prepare you for future academic pursuits, this unique program offers a blend of learning, culture, and community.

Your time with us will include:

  1. Engaging Tutorials: Dive into intellectually stimulating tutorials led by Oxford’s distinguished academics. With a student-to-teacher ratio of 1:3, our program uses Oxford’s unique tutorial teaching methodology to foster critical thinking and deep exploration of subjects.
  2. Admissions Preparation and Career Guidance: We offer specialized support to prepare you for competitive university applications, including guidance on personal statements, essay writing, and interview techniques.
  3. Essay Counselling: You will learn the art of essay writing in specialised classes, and our tutors and residential deans will be available around the clock to assist you in choosing the topics which interest you the most, conducting research, and drafting your essays.
  4. Debating at the Oxford Union: Public speaking is a core component of our program, with multiple workshops in debating and public speaking led by expert debaters at the world-famous Oxford Union. You’ll develop invaluable skills in argumentation, articulation, and persuasion.
  5. Inspirational Lectures: Attend thought-provoking lectures delivered by Oxford academics and guest speakers on diverse topics, inspiring you to consider new perspectives and global issues with a critical and analytical mind.


Cultural and Social Experiences


  1. Harry Potter-style Dining: Experience magical dining in Oxford’s historic halls, reminiscent of Harry Potter’s famous feasts, creating unforgettable memories.
  2. Cultural Exploration: Take part in guided tours of other historic Oxford colleges, explore local museums, and enjoy a walking tour of London to experience its vibrant culture and iconic landmarks.
  3. Global Friendships: Forge connections with students from around the world, building friendships that last a lifetime.
  4. University Accommodation: Each participant will have a private room with en-suite facilities in the beautiful campus of St Anne's College, giving you a genuine taste of Oxford student life.


Additional Resources


To give you a sense of what awaits, we encourage you to explore the following resources:

  1. Program Highlights Video: 2024 Program Glimpse
  2. Student Testimonials: The Oxford Institute - YouTube
  3. Website: The Oxford Institute Website
  4. Social Media: Instagram and Facebook


Next Steps


Please proceed with the payment of the initial deposit to confirm your seat, and kindly send us an email to update us once completed. Should you have any further questions or wish to speak with a member of our staff, please feel free to email us or call our landline.

International students requiring a visa must complete full fee payment (at least 4 months prior to the course start date) to receive a visa sponsorship letter.

We will keep you informed with program updates and send a pre-arrival questionnaire for you to complete. Please don’t hesitate to reach out with any questions or if you need further assistance.

Once again, congratulations on your admission to the {{programName}} 2025! We eagerly look forward to welcoming you to Oxford for an inspiring and memorable summer.

Yours Sincerely,

Lucy Aitchison

Program Coordinator

The Oxford Institute

T: +44 (0) 1865 600 840

E: info@theoxfordinstitute.co.uk

W: www.oxfordsummerprogram.com
